msItem.title: King's Parable: Part 1: Patriarch Abraham of Alexandria (d. 978), King al-Muizz, and the parable of the mustard seed (whole or opening)
A wealthy man named Romanos in Alexandria steals another man's wife while the man is lost at sea
Book of Nagara Maryam??: OldP: Journey: The Virgin Mary asks for bread from a poor widow during the flight from Herod
Book of Vision of Theophilus of Alexandria: Part 1 or 1.1: Patriarch Theophilus of Alexandria has a vision of the Virgin Mary telling him about the Holy Family's flight to Egypt
Book of Ledata la-Maryam??: OldA: Part 01: Conception: The Virgin Mary is conceived and born (whole or opening)

supportDesc.foliation: Foliation in the upper right corner by the library.

layout.ab: Primary pricks and horizontal pricks are visible.
The upper line is written above the ruling, the lower line is written above the ruling.

236

decoNote.desc: A woodcut is pasted on , which has been subsequently coloured with coarse paints.

item.desc:
Copy of a deed of gift by to the priests of . The ʾabuna of the time was and the ʾǝč̣č̣age
.
item.q: ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ መቅደስ፡ ዘትሰመይ፡ ደብረ፡ ጥበብ፡ እንተ፡ ተሐንጸት፡ በጽንፈ፡ ጎንደር።

item.desc: The note states that the manuscript belongs to the church of .
The name of occurs repeatedly, showing that the manuscript was written during his reign.
The name of is written at the foot of .

binding.decoNote: In the original boards, lined with silk and covered with blind-tooled leather.

history.provenance: The manuscript had very probably belonged to a church in the area, from where it was taken by and brought to . It was then looted by the British Napier expedition in 1868.
